net.powermatcher.api.data

Class PriceStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.powermatcher.api.data.PriceStep

  • public class PriceStep
extends java.lang.Object
    This immutable data object represents a priceStep and its MarketBasis. A priceStep is the index in the demand array. This is an integer and can be any value between 0 and marketbasis.priceSteps. The value 0 corresponds to the minimal price and marketbasis.priceStep - 1 corresponds to the the maximal price.

      • isMaximum

        public boolean isMaximum()
        Returns:
        true when the PriceStep is at its maximum (e.g. marketBasis.getPriceSteps() - 1)

      • isMinimum

        public boolean isMinimum()
        Returns:
        true when the PriceStep is at its minimum (e.g. 0)

      • increment

        public PriceStep increment()
        Returns:
        The PriceStep that is exactly 1 step above the current.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when it is already at its maximum level.

      • decrement

        public PriceStep decrement()
        Returns:
        The PriceStep that is exactly 1 step below the current.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when it is already at its minimum level.

      • toPrice

        public Price toPrice()
        Creates a Price, based on the MarketBasis as the priceStep.
        Returns:
        the new Price
